fullProgramDescription: The Department of Scandinavian Studies offers a major in Dutch Studies, which focuses on the language, literature, and culture of the Netherlands. The program is designed to provide students with a deep understanding of the Dutch language and its cultural context, as well as the historical and contemporary significance of the Netherlands in Europe and the world.
shortProgramDescription: The Dutch Studies major at UC Berkeley provides students with a comprehensive education in Dutch language, literature, and culture, preparing them for careers in fields such as education, government, and international business.
classHighlights: Language Courses: Students take a sequence of Dutch language courses (Dutch 101-102, 103-104, 105-106) to develop their language skills, with a focus on reading, writing, speaking, and listening comprehension.

Literature and Culture Courses: Students explore Dutch literature and culture through courses such as Dutch 130 (Introduction to Dutch Literature), Dutch 131 (Dutch Culture and History), and Dutch 132 (Dutch Literature and Culture in Translation).

Electives and Specialized Courses: Students can choose from a range of electives, including courses on Dutch history, culture, and society, as well as specialized topics such as Dutch colonialism and postcolonialism.

Advanced Language and Literature Courses: Students take advanced language courses (Dutch 107, 108) and literature courses (Dutch 133, 134) that focus on specific topics such as the Dutch Golden Age, Dutch modernism, and contemporary Dutch literature.

Interdisciplinary Approaches: The major encourages students to explore Dutch Studies from an interdisciplinary perspective, incorporating insights from fields such as history, cultural studies, and linguistics.
learningOutcomes: Demonstrate a high level of proficiency in the Dutch language, including reading, writing, speaking, and listening comprehension.
Analyze and interpret Dutch literary and cultural texts in their historical and cultural context.
Understand the historical and contemporary significance of the Netherlands in Europe and the world.
Apply interdisciplinary approaches to the study of Dutch culture and society.
Develop critical thinking and research skills in the field of Dutch Studies.
creditRequirements: 120 semester credits (including major requirements and breadth courses)
additionalInformation: Students are encouraged to study abroad in the Netherlands or Flanders to enhance their language skills and cultural knowledge. The major prepares students for careers in fields such as education, government, international business, and cultural institutions.
